original: Forssman, Hans Axel, med. dr, Göteborg, f. 23/5/12 i Gbg av adv. Axel F. o. Dagmar Levisson. — Stud:ex. 30, med. kand. 33, med. lic. 40, med. dr 45, doc. i prakt. med. i Upps. 45. Förordn. v. psyk. o. rättspsyk. klin. i Sthlm 38-39, v. Beckomberga sjukh. 41-42 samt v. med. klin. i Upps. 40 o. 42-45, und :läk. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. psyk. avd. sed. 46. Led. av styr. f. Gbgs Hand:- o. Sjöfartstidn. A-B sed. 42, ordf. i Upps. stud:kår 45-46. Skr.: avh. samt två smärre skr. om heredi-tär diabetes insipidus.
translated: Forssman, Hans Axel, PhD, Gothenburg, born on May 23, 1912 in Gothenburg to lawyer Axel F. and Dagmar Levisson. He graduated high school in 1930, received his Bachelor of Medicine in 1933, his medical license in 1940, his PhD in 1945, and became a practicing physician in Uppsala in 1945. He was awarded positions at the psychiatric and forensic clinics in Stockholm from 1938-1939 and at Beckomberga Hospital from 1941-1942, as well as at the medical clinics in Uppsala from 1940 and 1942-1945. He worked as an assistant physician at Sahlgr. Hospital's psychiatric department starting in 1946. He served as a member of the board for Gothenburg's Hand and Maritime Times AB since 1942 and was the chairman of Uppsala's student body from 1945-1946. He wrote several essays and two smaller works on hereditary diabetes insipidus.
